attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Mrs May
attributes.additional_details: As we head closer to Brexit, though the deadline has magically extended, we look back on 2 years of poor choices and hypocritical statements - calling a general election that weakened her position, no budging on having another referendum after we learned of the misinformation provided before the first yet trying to push her deal through parliament 3 times without amendments - now’s the time to show we have no trust in our ‘leader’!
attributes.background: Mrs May has had ample opportunity to get this right and she has failed at every hurdle. Cast your vote to show we are fed up with her inability to lead.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for a vote of no confidence.

We used to accept petitions that called for a vote of no confidence. However, the Petitions Committee can’t schedule votes of no confidence. This was often frustrating and disappointing for petitioners.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that. 
Petitions calling for action on policy are more likely to be an effective way of achieving the change you want.
